subject: Re: Thoughts on My Antique Communication Device?
author: Urkel23
full_text:
Looks like an old crystal radio.

-Steve



--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Kris Bronson <the_rocker_chick1@...> wrote:
>
> I'll be the first to admit I'm no expert when it comes to ITC. The majority of 
> my experience comes from working with Chris (Moon) and his box for the past 3 
> years. The results still never cease to amaze me! 
> 
> Anyhow, I came across this device at an estate auction. It appears to be an 
> antique communication device of some sort. The only verifiable information I 
> have is that is was probably built around 1910-1912, which is before radio was 
> publicly available. 
> (I obtained this date from researching the packaging cylinder used to build the 
> device.) 
> 
> Does anyone have any thoughts on what it might be? I did show this device to 
> Chris a while back and he agreed that it probably was a communication device. He 
> also suggested I show it to Frank... = )
> According to Chris's box, "this IS a communication device of historical value." 
> It also mentioned the device was "meant specifically for me to have, but no 
> longer worked." There was more, but I'm trying to remain unbiased and only 
> use tangible evidence. However, I have little to go on.
> 
> If anyone has any clues or can lead me in a research direction I would 
> appreciate it! Thanks!
>
